abstracts.cdata!:
This is an environmental assessment of
            the Sanitation Sector Modernization Project, Second Phase
            (PMSS II) for Brazil, which has the objective of promoting
            the sector s reorganization and institutional restructuring,
            including promoting investment programs that broaden
            coverage and improve water and sanitation service quality
            for the northern, northeastern, and central western regions.
            The report describes the program for strengthening
            environmental management agencies that license and oversee
            municipal service providers in the water and sanitation
            sector; proposing procedures, criteria for classifying
            environmental harms, and the terms of reference for specific
            studies on environmentally managing wastewater and
            sanitation projects as well as guidelines for
            environmentally managing the PMSS II project specifically
            during both its construction and operation phases.
            Components crucial to environmental management consist of
            organizational structure, establishment of procedures,
            mobilization of physical resources (technology and technical
            assistance), and training and development of human
            resources. The project lists liquid effluent disposal, solid
            waste management, debris removal, and noise control among
            the potential environmental concerns that measures must
            address. Added are plans for resettling and compensating the
            population--mainly squatters--to be relocated away from the
            excavation and construction sites; and for reforesting and
            replanting (mango development}.
